timeline.message: fix for empty store response statistics

timeline.author: xinlian12
xinlian12

replies.bodyText: I think its fine to continue with current logic , because we are not interested in result of other replica in case of these exceptions and break the flow
replies.author: simplynaveen20

replies.bodyText:
Good observation: I would prefer option 2) - but am not quite sure yet whether there are certain scenarios - like 429 from only a subset of replicas - where this could negatively impact latency. My assumption is that the impact is negligible and 2) looks cleaner to me - so my vote would be for 2)
@simplynaveen20  / @moderakh - what do you think?
replies.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText:
We don't need either of these two options, earlier code was also not caring about other replica responses in case of certain exceptions. Its like fire and forget if we hit error in any replica , we don't care about the response from other replica. In case of multiple responses come successfully  together before this code , we will have multiple store result in diagnostics , which is also fine.
So i don't think any code change is needed and above two options have unnecessary perf implication . Have offline conversation with Annie on this
replies.author: simplynaveen20

timeline.author: simplynaveen20

timeline.bodyText: if two replica reach the diagnostic capture block at same time then we will have two results ?
timeline.author: simplynaveen20

replies.bodyText:
since for write scenario, we will only contacted the primary replica, so it will only contain one replica.
In the StoreReader test, since it could happen we will record multiple results, so the check there is >=1
replies.author: xinlian12

timeline.message: merge and resolve conflicts from master
